wikipedia_page.main: Professor John Richard Ockendon FRS (born c. 1940) is an applied mathematician noted especially for his contribution to fluid dynamics and novel applications of mathematics to real world problems.  He is a Professor at the University of Oxford and an Emeritus Fellow at St Catherine's College, Oxford, the first Director of the Oxford Centre for Collaborative Applied Mathematics (OCCAM) and a former Director of the Smith Institute for Industrial Mathematics and System Engineering.
